meanings.sent1: After the rope came loose, I had to retie it securely.
meanings.sent2: She needed to retie her shoelaces before going for a run.
meanings.sent3: I had to retie the gift wrap because the bow looked crooked.
meanings.sent4: The friendship between them was so strong, it seemed to retie itself effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: He watched her retie the knot with precision, impressed by her skill.

meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with a knot or bow.
meanings.sent1: He had to retie the fishing line to catch more fish.
meanings.sent2: She asked him to retie the ribbon on her hair.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to retie the scarves into a rabbit, but it turned into a hat instead.
meanings.sent4: The bond between them was so strong, it felt like they could retie the universe together.
meanings.sent5: The sailor had to retie the sails quickly to avoid the storm.

meanings.definition: To bind or connect by tying.
meanings.sent1: She had to retie the broken string to fix the necklace.
meanings.sent2: He decided to retie the loose ends of the rope to make it more secure.
meanings.sent3: The clown tried to retie the balloon animals, but they kept popping.
meanings.sent4: Their shared memories seemed to retie them together even when they were far apart.
meanings.sent5: The spider had to retie its web after a strong wind blew it away.
